website_summaries.verdict: You don't have to have a green thumb to experience good results with these seeds, as they come from a top company, include a growing guide, and are known to develop hearty plants almost every time.
pros: Wide variety of vegetables – 32 different kinds
Ample seeds to plant entire garden
cons: Not all growers experienced high germination rates

customer_reviews.title: Change in price
customer_reviews.text: These were great seeds for 15.00 looks Like they’re now selling for 54?
customer_reviews.author: Jessoca

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but price gouging because of pandemic. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for 16 dollars last year, now they increased it to 55 dollars. The seeds were good but will not buy from this company ever again.
customer_reviews.author: jack morris

customer_reviews.title: Old Dead Seeds That Won't Germinate.
customer_reviews.text: How freaking old are these seeds? I've been gardening for decades, not a green thumb, but reasonably successful and I thought "32 varieties" would add some fun to this year's garden. I used several different methods of germination and out of the 15,000 seeds and ONLY ONE SPROUTED.... a sunflower that died after transplanting. That is an incredibly poor return on the investment of both my money and my time. The "Seed Vault" will NEVER see my business again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Looking good so far!
customer_reviews.text: **Update. These have done pretty darn well. Outside of a few that didn't germinate, the vast majority have done great. See photos. Turnips, beats, zuchinni, radishes, cucumbers, winter squash, green beans, okra, and more. Excellent value for $15. So far so good. I am about a week out and at least 50% have sprouted. I will update later with results.
customer_reviews.author: TomCrone77

customer_reviews.title: Keep moving, nothing to see here...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely poor germination rates. Planted over 100 of the various seeds from this kit- Only two sprouted (broccoli). All else didndonuffin. Went to the local home improvement store, purchased some seeds, planted in the same fashion as this kit, had 100% germination. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Exodus

customer_reviews.title: Hijacking the price because of a pandamic
customer_reviews.text: These seeds actually sprouted well - purchased twice for myself and son. I am beyond disgusted, however, at the jacking of prices. I paid about $16 in 2019 and now $55. Wow.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mmiller

customer_reviews.title: Everything's sprouting
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought but it's still plenty for what we need. We started the eggplant, bell peppers, tomatoes, and celery in a mini green house seed starting kit and everything is sprouting (we're still waiting on the bell peppers and the others have tiny sprouts you can't see well in the photos) the tomatoes are growing super fast! Excited for spring so I can plant more!
customer_reviews.author: A.Mata

customer_reviews.title: I thought that seeds usually had a 50/50 survival rate ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought that seeds usually had a 50/50 survival rate? Every seed in this packet grew a plant!!! This was my second garden ever, and half of it, I did from seed (my first year was all store-bought plants). SO MANY VEGETABLES. I will buy this again next year and save it as an emergency pack (as intended). I definitely will continue doing business with this company.
customer_reviews.author: RachelM

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Half of the seeds grew pretty well, the other half had low to no germination rate. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Han Gao

customer_reviews.title: Shorted me seeds
customer_reviews.text: Shorted me on all of the seeds! Very unhappy about that! For example, only recived 12 seeds of some varieties that listed 25 seeds.
customer_reviews.author: kodi tate

customer_reviews.title: Good quality seeds
customer_reviews.text: The seed are of excellent quality and have about 100% germination rate for the seeds I have planted. I am really happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: amie

customer_reviews.title: Watch the price
customer_reviews.text: For those of you shopping for this during the COVID-19 period, watch the price on this item. I see it is currently going for over $54, for what is really a small collection of seeds. The package is nice, and I've had no problems with the varieties or germination, but you only get a small quantity of each type of seed. For reference, I paid $15.95 for this package in August 2019. I feel it is a good value at that price, but an absolute rip-off at anything over $25.
customer_reviews.author: G. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your summer on these weird plants.
customer_reviews.text: These are useless. Every plant that came up is a mutant disaster. They resemble nothing I ever saw. Puny plants and no harvest at all. The broccoli plants are spindly and weird with little flowers and no discernible fruit. I would never waste a garden on these. I am very disappointed. I’ve been gardening 40 years so it’s not like I don’t know what I’m doing. Ugh. No.
customer_reviews.author: Sister Mary

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, but extreme price gouging taking place here.
customer_reviews.text: Just last year I purchase this product at $15 and it's now well over $50. Clear price gouging at work and extremely disappointing, I refuse to buy anything else from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Hoss

customer_reviews.title: $16 in 11/2019, $55 because of Covid? Really?
customer_reviews.text: I lost the seed grow guide that was included, but it seems that the lettuces are sprouting nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Apprentice Urban Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Dont grow
customer_reviews.text: Alot of seeds didn't grow and the ones that did died after a week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3x increase in price for seeds that don't germinate
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in July of 2019 for $16. I used them this spring and they had about a 10% - 45% germination rate depending on what was planted. None of the bell pepper seeds sprouted. They were stored unopened in a dark, dry temperature controlled environment until use. I had seeds from another company that were almost 10 years old that had a better success rate. Bell peppers from that company did sprout, so it wasn't user error. For $16 I wasn't too disappointed. However, less that a year later they have more than tripled the price. I would not count on these for long term storage or survival, especially at the price of $50.
customer_reviews.author: Dstone

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed: (
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kid's botany class and not a single seed sprouted! And we followed the directions to the letter. Disappointed :(
customer_reviews.author: Billie

customer_reviews.title: Under 5% Germination
customer_reviews.text: Under 5% germination using several methods. They DO NOT stand by their product and have made ridiculous statements in their emails to us. They refuse to refund the purchase price claiming they want us to dig up the seeds and return them for their examination. Obviously old seeds and completely worthless.
customer_reviews.author: We Review Products

customer_reviews.title: Price gouging
customer_reviews.text: Great product grows well want to order more but the price has went from 13.95 to 59.00 ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: red man10

customer_reviews.title: Seeds failed to grow.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that I could buy it for $15. I don’t like that I tried to buy it this year and it went up to $55. I thought I could trust this seed company. And the seeds I did plant last year barely took. This company is a rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Shorty

customer_reviews.title: Variety poor and the 32 packs containing a few seeds isn’t pleasing... :(
customer_reviews.text: I’m not excited about the veriaty. I was not expecting it to be 32 small packs with a few seeds
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Popped right out of the ground after a week
customer_reviews.text: Popped out of the ground almost a week after planting.
customer_reviews.author: david dickerson

customer_reviews.title: great seeds but.....
customer_reviews.text: great seeds but I purchased on Sept 2019 for $15.95
customer_reviews.author: bn1340

customer_reviews.title: Great germination, awesome for a beginner gardeners!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a first-time gardener, I’ve never planted or maintained any plant before. I was excited to start this project and see how successful it would turn out. I started some of my seeds indoors on 1/21 and the picture is of 1/28. I would say that I have had 100% germination with the seeds I planted. I planted tomatoes, onion, cabbage, brussels sprouts, swiss chard, kale, 3 lettuce types, eggplant and cauliflower. I had them in my unheated garage on a heat mat under grow lights and I am now starting to get the second set of leaves. I should be moving outdoors in a few weeks and will update my review if my memory serves me well.
customer_reviews.author: BAHiker

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointing, did not produce harvestable produce.
customer_reviews.text: I see a lot of reviews about germination. But not that many about actually harvesting produce. My biggest disappointment was that what we did get to grow grew great, but did not produce, well, any produce. Radishes came up never produces a root to eat. Same with turnips, carrots, beets and probably with the parsnips to. Only a few plants germinated from all the peas and beans seeds. And hears the kicker almost all the corn came up, ok, great, right, wrong, big beautiful tall corn stalks AND NOT ONE FREAKING COB OF CORN PRODUCED! SERIOUSLY! How does one survive on harvesting seeds from plants that grow nothing? FYI, our garden was on virgin soil well fertilized.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Savka

customer_reviews.title: Non-growing
customer_reviews.text: I planted my seeds at the same time as seeds I purchased at a garden store. My garden store seeds are producing vegetables, yet my seeds purchased from you are not growing, at all. For example, I planted your zucchini and store bought yellow squash, both are non GMOs and organic, yet my squash has bloomed and the zucchini has barely come out of the top of the soil. Same pot, same soil, same everything. I am not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: KathySedai

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy. We haven't reached ur first harvest yet
customer_reviews.text: I was fully expecting a 50/50 rate of success out of these seeds as that is what I've always experienced with EVERY pack of seeds I've ever purchased. I had about 98% of my planted seeds sprout. Of those, 100% made it through the starter pods, and through their first transplant. Now, out of 40 plants, 38 have made it to the final transfer into their beds. I'm happy. We haven't reached ur first harvest yet, but I've never had such healthy looking plants like this at this stage. I'll purchase again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Growing great a few years later.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these almost 3 years ago and have been using them since. I usually order from fancy heirloom catalogues but that year I didn't feel like dealing with all that. This year I grew the Swiss chard (never tried growing it before) and discovered growing it is so much easier than kale, lettuces, spinach, and all the other greens I've been growing for years. The chard never bolted, and is still growing happily now that the temp has been dropping to 30 degrees at night. I'm really glad I bought this because not only is it a great value but I discovered my new favorite greens!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel M.

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Currently price gouging
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is outstanding. The price has been blown out of proportion during this coronavirus farce. I paid $15.95 about a year ago. Now it's $54.95??? Seriously?
customer_reviews.author: Richard C.

customer_reviews.title: 5-star product. 0 complaints. 0 problems. 100% satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that the packaging tells you exactly what to do and what to expect, and the product actually follows through with its promises. The germination rates, growth rates, and estimated harvest times in the product guide were all accurate (FYI, I live in the SF Bay area). I followed the directions that were included, and the plants grew precisely as described. Plus these seeds are the healthiest looking seeds I have ever seen, and I appreciate the easy ziplock and clear labeling, which makes for easy storing and organizing. My only wish is that the company would have a more extensive catalog of seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Bolton

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, Pricey, Pricey!
customer_reviews.text: At the beginning of the pandemic, my thought was to grow a "victory garden." There are two inter-related reasons why I returned the package of seeds unopened. Granted, there are a lot of seed packets contained. However, many of the choices were vegetables that I would not choose to eat, such as chard, kale, and okra. Second, this big selection of seeds is expensive. Last, but not least, it is considerably harder to grow fruits and vegetables from seed than from small plants available at the stores.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Out of two years of ysing this pack I have to say in theory it's a great idea. Unfortunately only the squash and peppers ever sprouted. That's jalapenos and squash. Of all the seeds. I've tried them all two years in a row and only squash and jalapenos sprout. Would not recommend these to anyone. It makes you feel good to have them for emergency sake...but if they don't work....they don't work..
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Large variety but the packages of the individual seeds are small in quantity. Not worth the price. I will buy separate packages of seeds in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not think twice, BUY THIS KIT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have never grown a garden in my life, and this collection of seeds made it so much easier. The germination rate was amazing, and the vegetables were so healthy and plentiful-all for 15 bucks. I bought some other seeds from the store and they pale in comparison to the product of this kit. I grew about 70% of the seeds they supplied (same with the awesome herb garden survival kit) and almost all of them came to fruition- with no experience! I can't say enough good things about this product and how it opened my life to horticulture, I will be a gardener forever! Thank you survival kit!!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Nothing came out
customer_reviews.text: I live in California and I strictly followed instructions to sew the seeds. However nothing sprouted. Three weeks later I sewed another round, still nothing. My garden this year is empty due to these seeds. I had high hope and got new soils etc. super super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: bunny

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money, this Is the second year I have tried to grow from these seeds. Bought the best soil, kept them warm, put In greenhouse, plenty of water, (not to much) and they will not grow, waisted money now I will have to go buy plants again. SO DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY OR TIME.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the beginnner or even the Pro!
customer_reviews.text: If you are into Emergency Preparedness or just regular gardening, this seed collection is a must-have! I’m somewhat new to gardening, when I would have a garden I would always buy the already mature plants from the garden centers. I was nervous starting these seeds myself, but every single seed that I planted has sprouted into beautiful and healthy seedling ahead of the average germination rate for each plant! I used an LED grow light 16hrs on and 6 off, and they are doing so well!! I plan on purchasing more to gift to my family and prepper friends. This has been such a joy! Thank you Open Seed Vault, I will sing your praises indefinitely!
customer_reviews.author: berkley

customer_reviews.title: Healthy seeds. Buy them.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely packaged. Beautiful looking seeds. Haven't planted them yet, but have worked with seeds before and can tell these se healthy. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Easy to identify 30 varieties of my seeds!
customer_reviews.text: Well packed in resealable mylar. 30 varieties packed in small plastic resealable bags. Each bag is clearly marked as to what seeds are enclosed. There is a booklet enclosed that no only tells you how to plant the seeds, but also explains how to save and dry seeds from your vegetables. Hope we never have to use for survival, but confident these survival garden heirloom seeds will be ready if we need them. I'll plant some of these soon and let you know how germination goes, but I can tell the seeds are top quality.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hattaway

customer_reviews.title: Great Value! First time gardening, and lots harvested!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try growing vegetables in containers. I rent, so tearing up the soil wasn’t an option. I’ve never grown anything before. I used this seed kit for almost everything in pictured in my garden. The germination rate was superb. I ended up having way to many seedlings and not enough containers and soil for them. I had to give seedlings away, and even composted some that never found a home. So far, I’ve had carrots, radishes, cucumber, zucchini, beans, peas and a variety of leafy green harvested. All tasted delicious. Best of all, I still have A LOT of seeds left to continue to plant with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Misleading .... very small package of seeds for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing in amount of seeds. Save yourself some money and go to your local farm store and buy packets of what you like and get enough to be adequate.
customer_reviews.author: H L B

customer_reviews.title: Old dead seeds, nothing germinated.
customer_reviews.text: Planted over 20 seeds and not a single one germinated. What a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Bad seed
customer_reviews.text: Really bad seeds. Few germinate. Slow growing. None are normal looking or growing.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory based on appearance, shipping, packaging; and germination!
customer_reviews.text: Based solely on the packaging, shipping, and product appearance; satisfactory for the price. I will have a full review of this product at the end of the fall harvest! Update 1: I planted three different varieties (pumpkin, cucumber, and butter crunch lettuce) and had 100% germination in pots indoors before planting season. Each seed I sewed germinated and is vibrant and healthy using run of the mill veggie potting soil from Walmart. I’m so far EXTREMELY impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Whitworth

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I planted several varieties in our veggie garden this spring. Three plants came up. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Nati

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I generally do not review anything but thought that this product deserved a good review. I not only got them on time (in NYC, in which good delivery these pandemic days is a lot), but also were they complete. I planted them two weeks ago exactly and every single one of the seeds that I planted sprouted and has grown well. I also bought organic potting mix, so I assume that helps too. They even grew well when I live in a NYC apartment and they get like 5 hours of sun only. So honestly, would buy again 100% Note: I did hesitate because the price seemed to have gone up, but I think they’re worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Paulina de la Portilla

customer_reviews.title: Pricey now.
customer_reviews.text: Good seeds Tho they up the price , it used to buy $20 bucks , the must have realized the impending doom lol.
customer_reviews.author: fernando

customer_reviews.title: Don't throw your money away!
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. Hardly any sprouts. Best to go to Home Depot, Lowes, Ace, or your local gargen center. I would hate to be dependent on this "Survival seed pack"
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Simple packaging
customer_reviews.text: It is what it says. A mess of seeds in individually wrapped clear plastic bags with little tabs saying what you got. Planted about 200 seeds this year for a 60x60 garden and been harvesting. Havent tried to get seeds from our plants, so cant comment on heirloom or anything. Also, darn rabbits! Cant tell you how the beets are, all eaten. All in all happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Love these seeds, great garden variety.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve waited awhile to write this as I wanted to see how the seeds performed. I had a germination rate of at least 95% , I’ve been working with seed over 35 years. My garden is doing great, thank you for the variety, the fair price and for caring enough to keep non gmo seeds alive.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Low germination rate and not the seeds they list.
customer_reviews.text: Been planting these for a couple of years. First year, about 50% came with but that's not 50% of each plant. Some had 100% germination, some never sprouted at all. Also had two that did come up not be what was supposed to be in the bag. Radishes ended up tiny and white and the "beefsteak" tomatoes were some sort of yellow plum. This year, I planted what was left including the "Black Beauty" zucchini . I don't know what these are, but they're definitely not black beauty... Can't really record my observations on how each variety of plant did if they're not even what they say.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Jung

customer_reviews.title: They ALL sprout!
customer_reviews.text: Almost 1000 reviews can't be wrong so I'll keep this short. EVERYTHING I've started with these seeds grow. Almost alarmingly lol. I used to avoid starting from seed because of the frustration of throwing out soiled pots of rotten seeds. I didnt have high expectations with these but due to the economical value of starting your own seeds I persevered. I used multiple seeds per hole hoping for one to sprout. Well they ALL sprouted. I've been giving seedlings away because I have too many.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki Wah

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these seeds they don’t grow
customer_reviews.text: 90 percent of these seed don’t sprout. So disappointing. I even tried to sprout the seeds indoors. All other seeds I have bought even from Home Depot have grow,Easily! Don’t waste your money. Survival garden? How will people survive buying these seeds?!
customer_reviews.author: C. G.

customer_reviews.title: Great garden set.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical for the price, but so far, everything has grown. All plants are healthy and vigorous ... indeed, it's my impression that almost ALL of these seeds germinate (unlike seeds bought from my local hardware store!). Anyhow, couldn't be happier and have enough seeds to plant all summer. I haven't even touched the cauliflower, cabbage and cool-season seeds yet ... :)
customer_reviews.author: kobroic

customer_reviews.title: Seeds do not grow
customer_reviews.text: These seeds did not germinate. I’m a seasoned backyard farmer and very disappointed that I wasted time and space using these seeds to plant fall and winter crops.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn J. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I planted lettuce seeds in my container garden and ended up with ten nightshade plants. An invasive species?? Now I am anxious about the other seeds and trusting them in an emergency. Has anyone else tried to plant lettuce seeds or had a weird experience with these seeds?
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Wolf

customer_reviews.title: NonGMO great variety, and a tad of everything.
customer_reviews.text: My mother is a master gardener.. she loves to plant EVERYTHING.. and this gave her some great variety to just try out some things she had not ever bought.. we came up with some great things we had never planted and have ordered this a few times. She loves seeing the different stuff and its nice that they are NonGMO and heirloom variety as well.
customer_reviews.author: JT L.

customer_reviews.title: Good results with those I tested
customer_reviews.text: Last year was my first year of gardening and I tested many different seeds. I had good success with the seeds from this set. Got decent amount of lettuce, okra, and beans. The flowers on the okra were very beautiful, so although I don’t cook much with okra I’ll plant it again this year. I was also able to get some Lima beans (had only 3-4 plants). I’ve planted broccoli a few days ago and I could see sprouts in 2 days, so I’m excited to see what I can get from the leftover seeds from last year.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Exaggerated amount of seeds. No worth cost
customer_reviews.text: This is what $50 worth of seeds looks like? More like $5 worth.
customer_reviews.author: jodie

customer_reviews.title: Not just for Survival, USE TODAY!
customer_reviews.text: Sprouted some seeds from my pack for the Fall Season... Used a Jiffy seed starter kit and had seedlings sprouting in less than 5 days. Instruction booklet gives you a lot of guidance in terms of when to plant and spacing; but found most of the information on YouTube in terms of how to care and harvest the plants. Great kit, with many seeds that come individually packaged. One seed pack arrived a little open so some seeds were loose, but wasn't an issue to figure out what type of seed they were... Would purchase again, but the book tells you how to keep making more seeds... Probably still gonna another garden pack from the same company.
customer_reviews.author: Sound In The City

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Will buy more!
customer_reviews.text: Newbie with learning to grow vegetables from seeds, and the first batch of tomato seeds I tried from a separate vendor never did anything. I tried this company next and used double the seeds I did from my first attempt, just incase half of them were successful. Totally shocked when 100% of them started to grow. I had too many in each cup because i didnt expect the results I got. 38 little seedlings have been moved into their own pots and I have been able to share them with 2 other families already. Growing fast and strong, i will be buying a lot more. Thanks for a great product at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Heather B.

customer_reviews.title: Good but expensive now
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in 2016 for 13.95 usd why the huge mark up in 2020? I was considering getting more but not for this price
customer_reviews.author: ∵¤§ãΐŋ†♣∀₦₲ξℜ◈∴

customer_reviews.title: Survival garden
customer_reviews.text: Perfect kit for survival preparation. I couldnt resist the urge to plant these seeds for a fall garden. All the seeds germinated quickly and sustained decent growth until an early freeze. Look forward to planting the rest of these seeds in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife's garden as opposed to using store bought packets. Probably 90% of the seeds that she planted germinated well under proper conditions(light/water). Transplanted to the garden in mid May and all are doing great! Birds dug up the sunflowers, but all the veggies are doing great!
customer_reviews.author: shay lake

customer_reviews.title: Didn't germinate...
customer_reviews.text: Most of these didnt germinate, maybe I got a bad batch but it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kera

customer_reviews.title: Spouting within 48 hours!
customer_reviews.text: I started these the day they arrived. I literally had sprouts the next day (beans and broccoli). 48 hours later the pumpkins, cantaloupe, lettuce, okra and a few others were sending up sprouts!!! I still have a ways to go, but the initial germination results are encouraging!!
customer_reviews.author: Fix-it With Fran

customer_reviews.title: Purchased these for our 2020 garden.
customer_reviews.text: The broccoli, cauliflower, and cabbage are all coming up nicely. We just started the seeds last friday, (a week ago) and the broccoli was the first to pop up two days ago! We're excited to see how all the seeds do. I will say, I am disappointed in the number and variety of tomato and pepper seeds. We will definitely have to purchase some more from elsewhere. I will update this review as the growing season progresses.
customer_reviews.author: Hailey

customer_reviews.title: I have tried a several of the seeds but forgot ...
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a several of the seeds but forgot to record. but here is a pic of the Swiss Chard trial batch. (Beefsteak tomato in the back) Two green thumbs up!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia P.

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far except for the peas
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t planted everything yet, but have had good germination with the lettuces, turnips and radishes. Spinach is probably about 70%, beets 50%, and peas 10%. I’m sowing directly to new garden beds, so I’m not going to 100% blame the seeds-except for the peas. I planted some dollar store peas in the same area as these peas. Dollar store peas had 95% germination and I’ve only had two pea plants come up from this set.
customer_reviews.author: Lacie

customer_reviews.title: Great seed supply at great price
customer_reviews.text: Lots of selection and high viability. We used some right away for indoor sprouting prior to transplant. Some of the varieties have very few seeds in them - mostly the larger seed sizes like peppers, cabbage, cucumber, squash, melon. The small stuff like carrots and beets, lettuces and such have lots and lots of seeds. The price and packaging added in makes this a very good value.
customer_reviews.author: MarksALot

customer_reviews.title: Dead Seeds
customer_reviews.text: Only a miniscule few have germinated and the ones that have don't look like they are going to make it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Gode

customer_reviews.title: High germination rate
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic variety of seeds. I actually planted part of nearly every variety I received. I still have tons of seeds left over. All of them had fairly high germination rates. I was impressed. I am going to purchase another to store for long term. I just wanted to be sure they grew in the first place and they do. Far cheaper to buy in this manner than individual packets from a big box store. There were some things I could live without but grew anyways out of curiousity such as the Swiss chard. But all in all a great variety and you can always give away the ones you don’t want or can’t eat.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Fine!
customer_reviews.text: So far theyre growing! Havent had them full grown yet, but Ill try to keep ya updated!
customer_reviews.author: Squid Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great, bought it when it was only $20
customer_reviews.text: Provides all the seeds your typical garden could really ever need, with near 100% germination. The recent DOUBLE in price initially disgusted me since seeds are sold out everywhere, but I have to admit, if all varieties listed interest you, it's worth $50. At $20, I'd say it's the best purchase I have ever made. As long as the quality remains consistent, I'll admit the supply-demand price raise is fair. The actual bag does look far bigger in the picture than it actually is, which was initially disappointing, but that's just because they packed it so tightly. I have found no flaws with this product.
customer_reviews.author: NerdBird

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value, excellent seeds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pack to test direct sowing in a new garden area. Everything we sowed came up. Not everything produced fruit/veggies due to how late we planted, but everything germinated and grew. If you want to try out a diverse set of veggies, this is a great deal. In addition to being a "survival" garden set, this is a great newbie kit for trying out new veggies. The small pamphlet was accurate in describing sowing techniques. This really is one of the better deals I have bout from Amazon since I started using the service in 2006.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. Almost everything we planted grew and if it didn’t, it was definitely on our part. There was so much seeds that we still have half of the bag left for next year, there wasn’t enough room in our garden. I’m so excited seeing it all grow!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Great product and a good addition to your families contingency plan
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery and great value. I purchased as a fail-safe for my family and have these stored in my freezer. Most seeds will last a minimum of 5 years at room temperature if stored correctly and in the freezer certain hardy varieties can last better than 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: David V.

customer_reviews.title: Did not do as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Even though reading the directions and do as the instructions say, I was disappointed. It may work for someone else, but I will not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Doug S.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality seeds with easy instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent seeds. I can see that these are clearly of great quality, as every single one that I’ve planted has germinated. I was afraid of buying so many, as typically when I’ve done that, I haven’t had much luck. But that was not the case and so far, they are all growing very well. They came with detailed instructions for each packet of seeds which is very helpful. Biggest rave goes to the radishes, watermelon and sugar pie pumpkin seeds. They grew insanely fast and as of today I have a good size watermelon growing and several more on the way. I also found today 4 baby pumpkins. I cannot wait for harvest time!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent produce!
customer_reviews.text: First time buying these seeds, I would say over 95% of the seeds grew and we are zone 4. Very good quality!
customer_reviews.author: A. Sailer

customer_reviews.title: Very successful.
customer_reviews.text: I live in The Bahamas where it is sometimes hard to grow veggies due to the heat. I decided to do a test batch and I have planted beets, radishes, Swiss chard, beans, peas, cucumber and okra so far and had a 100% success rate. Very pleased with my first round of veggies! Looking forward to the next round with different veggies. Great selection and amazing amount of seeds too.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna

customer_reviews.title: Nice Seed Kit
customer_reviews.text: Nicely packaged, seeds have mostly germinated. I wanted to rebuy this seed kit for my mom, but I paid $18 two months ago and now it's $54. Feels a bit Covid predatory, but I guess this is supply and demand...
customer_reviews.author: HBH

customer_reviews.title: Writing this after the season is over
customer_reviews.text: For the most part the seeds did well. I had a few unexpected surprises. My cantaloupe turned out to be honey dew melon. My squash was not normal in terms of shape, color and size. Other than this, the seeds did well. Of course I'm in California and most items do well here.
customer_reviews.author: Dayna Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my brother as a gift. He plants a huge garden every year, with this year being his largest yet. I wanted to get this as it offered Non-GMO variety options of 32 different products. He has planted and started growing seedlings to plant when Spring comes around. So far, each of the seeds have sprouted and are going well. The seeds are in individual, labeled packages that come in a larger vacuumed sealed pack. I appreciated the instructions and growing guide as I am not as experienced as my brother and I'm also growing seedlings. Great gift.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie

customer_reviews.title: So Simple.....
customer_reviews.text: Each vegetable is placed in their own small ziploc bag and labeled. The seeds I decided to plant, I have had great luck with. I personally find that seeds grow the best when planted straight into the ground with well prepared soil.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Sat in sealed bag for 6 years...and still sprouted!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these 6 years ago just to have in case of an emergency. I planted them at 7280 ft high in the mountains of Colorado and every single seed came up. I’m so impressed with these seeds!!! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Day Plumbing

customer_reviews.title: We love these seeds!!!
customer_reviews.text: ***Update We are now one month and two days out, everything is kicking but! Our beans have their first pods, our Swiss chard is filling out, even our Sunflowers are doing good. Very pleased with this product!** We received our seeds Sunday afternoon(07/29). I checked today(Wednesday 08/01) and the Kale, Turnips, Okra, Lettuce and Brussels sprouts have all sprouted!!! I definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Chanpete

customer_reviews.title: Great seeds for beginners or seasoned gardeners!
customer_reviews.text: Love this packet! Everything is well-organized and there are so many seeds! The kale popped after 2-3 days! The instructions are VERY thorough and easy to follow - made it simple to plan out how and what I was going to grow. I also love the amount of variety in the seeds. That was a big selling point for me. Highly recommend to anyone looking to start growing their own food!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Van Norman

customer_reviews.title: Not waiting for the Zombie Apocalypse
customer_reviews.text: Nice well packaged and healthy looking seeds. Just enough of everything. Excited to try very soon and not waiting for the Zombie Apocalypse. Liked the growing guide too.
customer_reviews.author: Celia B. Lerner

customer_reviews.title: Sprouts right up bit no fruition
customer_reviews.text: Sprouted right up bit never brought veggies. Only a handful of tomatoes and 5 very disappointing cakes. Very dissatisfied
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Blum

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Sowed these all pictured on 09/09 (zone 9a). Left the peas and chard in a barrel planter outside with a single initial water. It's been rainy and hot where I am so I left them alone. I figured it would be a while before I saw activity, but these beans sprouted after just 5 days. Also, I started various seeds on a south facing window sill and the germination rate is not to be underestimated. I plan to sow less seeds to avoid having to thin so many out next time. I'm new to this and these seeds made it so easy. My garden brings me a lot of joy in these hard times, so thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Rooftop Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for what you get!
customer_reviews.text: Price is ridiculous for what you get....haven't planted yet.. so not sure about rate of germination, taste or flavor but seriously guys. Half the listed price would be more than fair!
customer_reviews.author: Greg McCormack

customer_reviews.title: Misleading information about seed count.
customer_reviews.text: Dislike: There nowhere to get a replacement for missing seeds. I started my spring planting in Los Angeles., Ca. recently. Zucchini - Black Beauty = 25-30 Seeds. I only got 15/25. Winter Squash - Waltham Butternut = 25-30 Seeds. I only got 19/25. Trust me, with this company you will "never" receive more seeds than it's advertised. Best James
customer_reviews.author: James Jew

customer_reviews.title: whatsoever, Do not buy not legit
customer_reviews.text: Even though the seeds are in an individual baggies they all look the same when grown this makes no sense at all and I don’t think this is a legit seed company whatsoever
customer_reviews.author: Rosemarie D Strollo

customer_reviews.title: Cost, variety, results big, abundant  veggies
customer_reviews.text: I loved the variety, the cost, the ease of use. Grew nice veggies and herbs. Cost was very good also.
customer_reviews.author: bobbie miller

customer_reviews.title: High quality, but Price Gauged!
customer_reviews.text: Love the seeds, but glad I bought them when they were $15 instead of $54!!
customer_reviews.author: dylan allen

customer_reviews.title: Germinating in 4 days! Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: So, firstly, the seeds were well packed and labeled for easy identification. I wasn’t sure these would germinate, so I only planted a few seeds of the beets, broccoli, okra, eggplant and butternut squash. I germinated outside in partial sun and initially covered. As you can see from the picture the seeds sprouted in only 4 days. (Still waiting on the eggplant to germinate, but to be fair the germination time is usually 7 to 14 days). So, I practically have 100% germination. I live in a tropical climate (which is currently 80-90 degree Fahrenheit currently). I’m happy I invested in these seeds. I will now plant more seeds. :-)
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Packed away.
customer_reviews.text: I've secreted away hundreds of these under my house so futures generations will be able to plant crops. I took all the tomatoes out though, because I don't like tomatoes.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Poor germination
customer_reviews.text: Poor germination rates and now price gouging. Same product cost me less and $18 last year. Now they want $55!
customer_reviews.author: PD

product_meta.title: Survival Garden 15,000 Non GMO Heirloom Vegetable Seeds Survival Garden 32 Variety Pack by Open Seed Vault

100% Naturally Grown and Open Pollinated seeds with high Germination Rate
Vegetable Growing and Seed Harvesting Guide Included with Seeds Tested for Maximum Germination and Yield.
USA Seeds Stored in Air Tight, Moisture Proof Resealable Bag for Safer, Long Term Storage
Carefully Selected Seed and Vegetable Varieties to Provide a Well Balanced Healthy Diet.
